intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. rosea, commonly known as the rose-colored field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and clusters of small, pink to rose-colored flowers. The flowers are typically arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences, known as cymes, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. The plant has serrated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower meadows.
